briefdescription.para: disallow -foo syntax that doesn't assign any value

detaileddescription.para: Flags controlling how config and command line arguments are validated and interpreted.

memberdef.type: std::map< OptionsCategory, std::map< std::string, Arg > > m_available_args
memberdef.definition: std::map< OptionsCategory, std::map< std::string, Arg > > m_available_args GUARDED_BY
memberdef.name: GUARDED_BY

detaileddescription.para: Returns true if settings values from the default section should be used, depending on the current network and whether the setting is network-specific.
Get setting value.
Result will be null if setting was unset, true if "-setting" argument was passed false if "-nosetting" argument was passed, and a string if a "-setting=value" argument was passed.
Get list of setting values.
Select the network in use
Return config file path (read-only)
Log warnings for options in m_section_only_args when they are specified in the default section but not overridden on the command line or in a network-specific section in the config file.
Log warnings for unrecognized section names in the config file.
Get the command and command args (returns std::nullopt if no command provided)
Get blocks directory path

simplesect.para: Blocks path which is network specific

detaileddescription.para: Get data directory path

simplesect.para: Absolute path on success, otherwise an empty path when a non-directory path would be returned

detaileddescription.para: Get data directory path with appended network identifier

simplesect.para: Absolute path on success, otherwise an empty path when a non-directory path would be returned

detaileddescription.para: Clear cached directory paths
Return a vector of strings of the given argument
Return true if the given argument has been manually set

simplesect.para: true if the argument has been set

detaileddescription.para: Return true if the argument was originally passed as a negated option, i.e. -nofoo.

simplesect.para: true if the argument was passed negated

detaileddescription.para: Return string argument or default value
Return path argument or default value

parameterdescription.para: Argument to get a path from (e.g., "-datadir", "-blocksdir" or "-walletdir")
Optional default value to return instead of the empty path.

simplesect.para: normalized path if argument is set, with redundant "." and ".." path components and trailing separators removed (see patharg unit test for examples or implementation for details). If argument is empty or not set, default_value is returned unchanged.

detaileddescription.para: Return integer argument or default value

simplesect.para: command-line argument (0 if invalid number) or default value

detaileddescription.para: Return boolean argument or default value
Set an argument if it doesn't already have a value

simplesect.para: true if argument gets set, false if it already had a value

detaileddescription.para: Set a boolean argument if it doesn't already have a value

simplesect.para: true if argument gets set, false if it already had a value

detaileddescription.para:
Returns the appropriate chain type from the program arguments.
ChainType::MAIN by default; raises runtime error if an invalid combination, or unknown chain is given.

Returns the appropriate chain type string from the program arguments.
ChainType::MAIN string by default; raises runtime error if an invalid combination is given.

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::string &name, const std::string &help, unsigned int flags, const OptionsCategory &cat)

detaileddescription.para: Add argument
Add subcommand
Add many hidden arguments
Clear available arguments
Check CLI command args

parameterdescription.para: when multiple CLI_COMMAND arguments are specified

detaileddescription.para: Get the help string
Return Flags for known arg. Return default flags for unknown arg.
Set default flags to return for an unknown arg.
Get settings file path, or return false if read-write settings were disabled with -nosettings.
Read settings file. Push errors to vector, or log them if null.
Write settings file or backup settings file. Push errors to vector, or log them if null.
Get current setting from config file or read/write settings file, ignoring nonpersistent command line or forced settings values.
Access settings with lock held.
Log the config file options and the command line arguments, useful for troubleshooting.
Get data directory path

parameterdescription.para: Append network identifier to the returned path

simplesect.para: Absolute path on success, otherwise an empty path when a non-directory path would be returned

detaileddescription.para: Return -regtest/-signet/-testnet/-testnet4/-chain= setting as a ChainType enum if a recognized chain type was set, or as a string if an unrecognized chain name was set. Raise an exception if an invalid combination of flags was provided.
